name: Storage
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Cloud Storage.

First, install @google-cloud/storage with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/storage

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/storageâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcs = require('@google-cloud/storage')();

Elsewhere

var gcs = require('@google-cloud/storage')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/storage are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Storage
methods.description:
ACLs

Google Cloud Storage uses access control lists (ACLs) to manage object and bucket access. ACLs are the mechanism you use to share files with other users and allow other users to access your buckets and files.

To learn more about ACLs, read this overview on Access Control.

methods.name: acl
methods.description:
Google Cloud Storage uses access control lists (ACLs) to manage object and bucket access. ACLs are the mechanism you use to share objects with other users and allow other users to access your buckets and objects.

This object provides constants to refer to the three permission levels that can be granted to an entity:

  • gcs.acl.OWNER_ROLE - ("OWNER")
  • gcs.acl.READER_ROLE - ("READER")
  • gcs.acl.WRITER_ROLE - ("WRITER")

examples.caption: Make all of the files currently in a bucket publicly readable.
Make any new objects added to a bucket publicly readable.
Grant a user ownership permissions to a bucket.

methods.name: bucket
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Cloud Storage bucket.

examples.code:
var albums = gcs.bucket('albums');
var photos = gcs.bucket('photos');

methods.name: channel
methods.description: Reference a channel to receive notifications about changes to your bucket.

methods.name: createBucket
methods.description:
Create a bucket.

Google Cloud Storage uses a flat namespace, so you can't create a bucket with a name that is already in use. For more information, see Bucket Naming Guidelines.

examples.caption: Create a bucket in a specific location and region. See the Official JSON API docs for complete details on the location option.
Enable versioning on a new bucket.

params.name: metadata.dra
params.description: • Specify the storage class as Durable Reduced Availability.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: getBuckets
methods.description: Get Bucket objects for all of the buckets in your project.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the buckets from your project as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: query.maxResults
params.description: • Maximum number of items plus prefixes to return.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.buckets
params.description: • List of all buckets from your project.
